snippet.textDisplay:
As an Arsenal fan, watching the end of that match was extremely painful and sent me into a micro-depression, but eventually I got over it, like 10 minutes later.
Here are some positive take aways from an Arsenal fan's perspective.
1) Now Arsenal can focus on the domestic league.
2) Now it is beyond anyone's doubt that to succeed at the top level, only having a good attack is insufficient. Investments in personnel, and a complete overhaul and development of strategy and tactics need to be made in defence.
3) Hey, chances are, we were never going to win the Europa league in the first place. So at least we got that out of the way before we got our hopes up.
snippet.textOriginal:
As an Arsenal fan, watching the end of that match was extremely painful and sent me into a micro-depression, but eventually I got over it, like 10 minutes later.
Here are some positive take aways from an Arsenal fan's perspective.
1) Now Arsenal can focus on the domestic league.
2) Now it is beyond anyone's doubt that to succeed at the top level, only having a good attack is insufficient. Investments in personnel, and a complete overhaul and development of strategy and tactics need to be made in defence.
3) Hey, chances are, we were never going to win the Europa league in the first place. So at least we got that out of the way before we got our hopes up.

snippet.textDisplay: Aubameyang is a solid striker but he's the last player I want in a clutch situation. This miss was even worse than his miss in CL for Dortmund a couple of years back. Also, forget that second goal, what's shocking is that first one.... it was easier for him than in training. I've never seen a more open header. Arsenal did not lose because of the second, they lost because of that first. You can say that Aubameyang should have won it which he should have.... but that first goal man.
snippet.textOriginal: Aubameyang is a solid striker but he's the last player I want in a clutch situation. This miss was even worse than his miss in CL for Dortmund a couple of years back. Also, forget that second goal, what's shocking is that first one.... it was easier for him than in training. I've never seen a more open header. Arsenal did not lose because of the second, they lost because of that first. You can say that Aubameyang should have won it which he should have.... but that first goal man.

snippet.textDisplay: That type of passive defending is beyond "scandalous defending" it's unforgivable at this level!!! David Luiz must have got either a bribe or he is the worst defender in the world, period. Never liked him, especially as a defender from Chelsea times and now how stupid Arsenal recruiter must have been to bring such a disaster defender in for Arsenal! He should have played in midfield or even forward. He is too dumb, passive and outrageous as a defender, a massive a liability! I hope he will be sold if any team is stupid enough to buy him!
snippet.textOriginal: That type of passive defending is beyond "scandalous defending" it's unforgivable at this level!!!
